message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.GT, cs.CV, cs.RO 

This paper proposes a method for managing AI complexity in real-time strategy games using a deep convolutional neural network (cs.CV) to select among a limited set of abstract action choices (cs.AI) and utilizing game tree search to improve low-level tactics (cs.GT). The network is trained by supervised learning (cs.LG) on game states labelled by Puppet Search, a strategic search algorithm that uses action abstractions. The experiments are conducted in the microRTS game (cs.RO), which is a subfield of AI and game theory.
